Religious sacrificial ceremonies

From ancient times, what emperor who received the mandate did not perform the feng and shan sacrifices? There have been those who performed the sacrifices without awaiting the proper omens, but never those who witnessed auspicious signs without ascending Mount Tai. Though they received the mandate, their achievements fell short; reaching Liangfu, their virtue lacked harmony; being harmonious, they lacked sufficient leisureâ€”so the rites were rarely performed. The tradition says: 'Three years without performing the rites, the rites must fall into disuse; three years without performing music, the music must deteriorate.' In each flourishing era, the feng and shan sacrifices respond to it; when it declines, they cease. The distant ones were more than a thousand years ago, the nearer ones several hundred years agoâ€”therefore their ceremonies have gaps and are buried in oblivion; their details cannot be obtained and recorded.

The Book of History says: Shun resided at the Jade Sieve and Jade Balance, using them to align the seven celestial governors. Then he offered sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, made fragrant offerings to the six ancestors, gazed upon the mountains and rivers, and universally honored all spirits. He collected the five auspicious tokens, selected auspicious months and days, met with the lords of the four sacred peaks and all the regional governors, and returned the tokens. In the second month of the year, he conducted the eastern inspection tour, arriving at Mount Tai. He climbed the mountain, built an earthen altar to sacrifice to heaven, and buried the tablets of the covenant. He descended and leveled the earth for an altar to sacrifice to earth, transmitting the governance. Those who performed the Feng and Shan were twenty-eight rulers, but I will not record them all. Shun's Feng and Shan sacrifices were grand and elaborate, with ritual vessels and ceremonies appropriate to their achievements. Yu's Feng and Shan were simple and unadorned, with ritual vessels and ceremonies matching his frugal virtue. The Feng and Shan of the Xia, Shang, and Zhou dynasties each followed their own precedents. The Feng and Shan of the Xia dynasty used dark-colored robes and caps, simple and plain. The Feng and Shan of the Shang dynasty used white robes and caps, pure and bright. The Feng and Shan of the Zhou dynasty used red robes and caps, brilliant and flourishing. The Feng and Shan of the Qin dynasty used black robes and caps, deep and solemn. Since the Qin unified the realm, the feng and shan ceremonies have been discontinued. All were performed according to Dai Zong's rites. When the realm was at peace, the Son of Heaven wished to perform the feng and shan sacrifices. He summoned scholars of the five classics to discuss the feng and shan ceremonies.

The scholars said: "The feng and shan ceremonies are rarely performed and long discontinued." We examine the precedents of the ancient kings who performed feng and shan. The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Liangfu. Yao performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Liangfu. Yi Zhi said: 'Demons cannot overcome virtue.' Yu performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Kuaiji. Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this. King Cheng of Zhou performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Sheshou. These were the precedents of the ancient sages. Now the Han has unified the realm and pacified the barbarians. The realm is peaceful and the people prosperous. Auspicious omens appear and phoenixes arrive. This is the time to perform the feng and shan sacrifices. The emperor consulted with his ministers about performing feng and shan.

å‘¨å®˜æ›°ï¼Œå†¬æ—¥è‡³ï¼Œç¥€å¤©æ–¼å—éƒŠï¼Œè¿é•·æ—¥ä¹‹è‡³ï¼› å¤æ—¥è‡³ï¼Œç¥­åœ°ç¥—ã€‚ çš†ç”¨æ¨‚èˆï¼Œè€Œç¥ä¹ƒå¯å¾—è€Œç¦®ä¹Ÿã€‚ å¤©å­ç¥­å¤©ä¸‹åå±±å¤§å·ï¼Œäº”å¶½è¦–ä¸‰å…¬ï¼Œå››ç€†è¦–è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯ç¥­å…¶ç–†å…§åå±±å¤§å·ã€‚ å››ç€†è€…ï¼Œæ±Ÿã€æ²³ã€æ·®ã€æ¿Ÿä¹Ÿã€‚ å¤©å­æ›°æ˜å ‚ã€è¾Ÿé›ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ›°æ³®å®®ã€‚
The Zhou officials say: when the winter solstice arrives, sacrifice to heaven at the southern suburb, welcoming the arrival of longer days; They must be performed when the realm is at peace and auspicious omens appear. Now the Han has unified the realm for sixty years. The realm is peaceful and the people are happy. Auspicious omens appear frequently. This is indeed the time for feng and shan.

å‘¨å…¬æ—¢ç›¸æˆç‹ï¼ŒéƒŠç¥€åç¨·ä»¥é…å¤©ï¼Œå®—ç¥€æ–‡ç‹æ–¼æ˜å ‚ä»¥é…ä¸Šå¸ã€‚ è‡ªç¦¹èˆˆè€Œä¿®ç¤¾ç¥€ï¼Œåç¨·ç¨¼ç©¡ï¼Œæ•…æœ‰ç¨·ç¥ ï¼ŒéƒŠç¤¾æ‰€å¾ä¾†å°šçŸ£ã€‚
The emperor then decided to perform the feng and shan sacrifices. He sent officials to prepare Mount Tai for the ceremony.

è‡ªå‘¨å…‹æ®·å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œä¸–ç›Šè¡°ï¼Œç¦®æ¨‚å»¢ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ£è¡Œï¼Œè€Œå¹½ç‹ç‚ºçŠ¬æˆæ‰€æ•—ï¼Œå‘¨æ±å¾™é›’é‚‘ã€‚ ç§¦è¥„å…¬æ”»æˆæ•‘å‘¨ï¼Œå§‹åˆ—ç‚ºè«¸ä¾¯ã€‚ ç§¦è¥„å…¬æ—¢ä¾¯ï¼Œå±…è¥¿å‚ï¼Œè‡ªä»¥ç‚ºä¸»å°‘çšä¹‹ç¥ï¼Œä½œè¥¿ç•¤ï¼Œç¥ ç™½å¸ï¼Œå…¶ç‰²ç”¨é¨®é§’é»ƒç‰›ç¾ç¾Šå„ä¸€äº‘ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œåå…­å¹´ï¼Œç§¦æ–‡å…¬æ±çµæ±§æ¸­ä¹‹é–’ï¼Œåœå±…ä¹‹è€Œå‰ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬å¤¢é»ƒè›‡è‡ªå¤©ä¸‹å±¬åœ°ï¼Œå…¶å£æ­¢æ–¼é„œè¡ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬å•å²æ•¦ï¼Œæ•¦æ›°ï¼šã€Œæ­¤ä¸Šå¸ä¹‹å¾µï¼Œå›å…¶ç¥ ä¹‹ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä½œé„œç•¤ï¼Œç”¨ä¸‰ç‰²éƒŠç¥­ç™½å¸ç„‰ã€‚
He selected auspicious days and prepared the ritual vessels. The feng ceremony was performed on the summit of Mount Tai. After Qin Xiang Gong became marquis and dwelt on the western border, he considered himself master of Shao Hao's spirit, made the western zhi altar, sacrificed to the White Emperor, using as sacrificial animals one sorrel colt, one yellow ox, and one ram sheep each, it is said. The ceremony was grand and solemn. The scholars all said: "The feng and shan ceremonies should be performed." Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is an omen from the Supreme Deity; my lord should sacrifice to it.' The emperor summoned the scholars to discuss the feng and shan ceremonies.

è‡ªæœªä½œé„œç•¤ä¹Ÿï¼Œè€Œé›æ—æ•…æœ‰å³é™½æ­¦ç•¤ï¼Œé›æ±æœ‰å¥½ç•¤ï¼Œçš†å»¢ç„¡ç¥ ã€‚ æˆ–æ›°ï¼šã€Œè‡ªå¤ä»¥é›å·ç©é«˜ï¼Œç¥æ˜ä¹‹éš©ï¼Œæ•…ç«‹ç•¤éƒŠä¸Šå¸ï¼Œè«¸ç¥ç¥ çš†èšäº‘ã€‚ è“‹é»ƒå¸æ™‚å˜—ç”¨äº‹ï¼Œé›–æ™šå‘¨äº¦éƒŠç„‰ã€‚ã€ å…¶èªä¸ç¶“è¦‹ï¼Œç¸‰ç´³è€…ä¸é“ã€‚
They discussed the precedents and rituals of the ancient sages. Some say: 'From ancient times, Yong province has been piled high, a recess for spirits and brightness; therefore the zhi altars were established to suburb-sacrifice the Supreme Deity, and all the various spirit sacrifices gathered there as clouds. The Yellow Emperor once used these affairs, and even late Zhou also performed the suburban sacrifices there.' The scholars said: "The feng and shan ceremonies are the most important rites."

They require great virtue and auspicious omens to perform. The emperor has unified the realm and pacified the people. Auspicious omens appear frequently.
9
ä½œé„œç•¤å¾Œä¸ƒåå…«å¹´ï¼Œç§¦å¾·å…¬æ—¢ç«‹ï¼Œåœå±…é›ï¼Œã€Œå¾Œå­å­«é£²é¦¬æ–¼æ²³ã€ï¼Œé‚éƒ½é›ã€‚ é›ä¹‹è«¸ç¥ è‡ªæ­¤èˆˆã€‚ ç”¨ä¸‰ç™¾ç‰¢æ–¼é„œç•¤ã€‚ ä½œä¼ç¥ ã€‚ ç£”ç‹—é‚‘å››é–€ï¼Œä»¥å¾¡è ±è‘ã€‚
Seventy-eight years after making the Fu zhi, Qin De Gong was already established; he divined about dwelling in Yong: 'Later descendants will drink their horses at the river,' and then made Yong his capital. Yong's various sacrifices rose from this. The scholars agreed that the time was right for feng and shan. He established the hidden sacrifices. He had dogs torn apart and walled them at the four gates, to resist poison and calamities.

å¾·å…¬ç«‹äºŒå¹´å’ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œï¼ˆå…­ï¼‰ï¼»å››ï¼½å¹´ï¼Œç§¦å®£å…¬ä½œå¯†ç•¤æ–¼æ¸­å—ï¼Œç¥­é’å¸ã€‚
Four years later, Qin Wen Gong hunted east between the Qian and Wei rivers. He divined about dwelling there and it was auspicious.
11
å…¶å¾Œåå››å¹´ï¼Œç§¦ç¹†å…¬ç«‹ï¼Œç—…è‡¥äº”æ—¥ä¸å¯¤ï¼› å¯¤ï¼Œä¹ƒè¨€å¤¢è¦‹ä¸Šå¸ï¼Œä¸Šå¸å‘½ç¹†å…¬å¹³æ™‰äº‚ã€‚ å²æ›¸è€Œè¨˜è—ä¹‹åºœã€‚ è€Œå¾Œä¸–çš†æ›°ç§¦ç¹†å…¬ä¸Šå¤©ã€‚
Fourteen years later, Qin Mu Gong was established; he fell ill and lay unconscious for five days; Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: "This is an omen from the Supreme Deity; Your Lordship should sacrifice to it." They then built the Fu zhi altar and used three sacrificial animals to perform suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor. Before building the Fu zhi altar, Yong already had the Wu Yang Wu zhi nearby, and to the east there was the Hao zhiâ€”all abandoned without sacrifices.

ç§¦ç¹†å…¬å³ä½ä¹å¹´ï¼Œé½Šæ¡“å…¬æ—¢éœ¸ï¼Œæœƒè«¸ä¾¯æ–¼è‘µä¸˜ï¼Œè€Œæ¬²å°ç¦ªã€‚ ç®¡ä»²æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤è€…å°æ³°å±±ç¦ªæ¢çˆ¶è€…ä¸ƒåäºŒå®¶ï¼Œè€Œå¤·å¾æ‰€è¨˜è€…åæœ‰äºŒç„‰ã€‚ æ˜”ç„¡æ‡·æ°å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› è™™ç¾²å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› ç¥è¾²å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› ç‚å¸å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› é»ƒå¸å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº­äº­ï¼› é¡“é Šå°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› å¸åš³å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› å ¯å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› èˆœå°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› ç¦¹å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªæœƒç¨½ï¼› æ¹¯å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› å‘¨æˆç‹å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªç¤¾é¦–ï¼šçš†å—å‘½ç„¶å¾Œå¾—å°ç¦ªã€‚ã€ æ¡“å…¬æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¯¡äººåŒ—ä¼å±±æˆï¼Œéå­¤ç«¹ï¼› è¥¿ä¼å¤§å¤ï¼Œæ¶‰æµæ²™ï¼ŒæŸé¦¬æ‡¸è»Šï¼Œä¸Šå‘è€³ä¹‹å±±ï¼› å—ä¼è‡³å¬é™µï¼Œç™»ç†Šè€³å±±ä»¥æœ›æ±Ÿæ¼¢ã€‚ å…µè»Šä¹‹æœƒä¸‰ï¼Œè€Œä¹˜è»Šä¹‹æœƒå…­ï¼Œä¹åˆè«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œä¸€åŒ¡å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯è«é•æˆ‘ã€‚ æ˜”ä¸‰ä»£å—å‘½ï¼Œäº¦ä½•ä»¥ç•°ä¹ï¼Ÿã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ç®¡ä»²ç¹æ¡“å…¬ä¸å¯çª®ä»¥è¾­ï¼Œå› è¨­ä¹‹ä»¥äº‹ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤ä¹‹å°ç¦ªï¼Œé„—ä¸Šä¹‹é»ï¼ŒåŒ—é‡Œä¹‹ç¦¾ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç‚ºç››ï¼› æ±Ÿæ·®ä¹‹é–’ï¼Œä¸€èŒ…ä¸‰è„Šï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç‚ºè—‰ä¹Ÿã€‚ æ±æµ·è‡´æ¯”ç›®ä¹‹é­šï¼Œè¥¿æµ·è‡´æ¯”ç¿¼ä¹‹é³¥ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œç‰©æœ‰ä¸å¬è€Œè‡ªè‡³è€…åæœ‰äº”ç„‰ã€‚ ä»Šé³³çš‡éº’éºŸä¸ä¾†ï¼Œå˜‰ç©€ä¸ç”Ÿï¼Œè€Œè“¬è’¿è—œè èŒ‚ï¼Œé´Ÿæ¢Ÿæ•¸è‡³ï¼Œè€Œæ¬²å°ç¦ªï¼Œæ¯‹ä¹ƒä¸å¯ä¹ï¼Ÿã€ æ–¼æ˜¯æ¡“å…¬ä¹ƒæ­¢ã€‚ æ˜¯æ­²ï¼Œç§¦ç¹†å…¬å…§æ™‰å›å¤·å¾ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä¸‰ç½®æ™‰åœ‹ä¹‹å›ï¼Œå¹³å…¶äº‚ã€‚ ç¹†å…¬ç«‹ä¸‰åä¹å¹´è€Œå’ã€‚
Some said: "Since ancient times Yong province has accumulated height, being the recess of spirits, so they established zhi altars for suburban sacrifice to the Supreme Deity, and all spirit sacrifices gathered there." Guan Zhong said: 'In ancient times, those who performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Liang Fu numbered seventy-two families, and of those that Yi Wu recorded there are twelve. Formerly, the Wu Huai Shi performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Chu Xi performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Shen Nong performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; The Yan Emperor performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Ting Ting; Zhuan Xu performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Emperor Ku performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Yao performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Shun performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Yu performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Hui Ji; Tang performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Zhou Cheng Wang performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on She Shou: all received the mandate before they could perform feng and shan.' Huan Gong said: 'I attacked the Shan Rong in the north, passed through Gu Zhu; attacked Da Xia in the west, crossed the Flowing Sands, bound the horses and hung the chariots, ascended Bei Er Mountain; The Supreme Deity used the horse sacrifice, Red Emperor used the pig sacrifice, Yellow Emperor used the dog sacrifice, Green Emperor used the chicken sacrifice, White Emperor used the goat sacrifice. For all Emperor sacrifices, they used bamboo poles as mats. The Five Emperors' altar was a round mound; the Yellow Emperor and below all used square mounds. The former Three Dynasties received the mandateâ€”what was different about that?' Thereupon Guan Zhong saw that Huan Gong could not be convinced with words alone, so he set forth the requirements, saying: 'For ancient feng and shan ceremonies, there must be the millet from Xiang Shang and grain from Bei Li to make them abundant; Qin Xuan Gong built the Mi zhi south of the Wei River, sacrificing to the Green Emperor. Sixteen years later, Qin De Gong established the hidden sacrifices. Now phoenixes and qilins do not come, auspicious grains do not grow, but cogon grass and thorns flourish, owls arrive frequentlyâ€”yet you wish to perform feng and shan; would that not be impossible?' Four years later, Qin Wen Gong hunted east between the Qian and Wei rivers, divined about dwelling there and it was auspicious. Wen Gong dreamed of a yellow serpent descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan. Afterward he established three lords for the state of Jin and pacified their chaos. They then built the Fu zhi altar and used three sacrificial animals to perform suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor.

In the fourth month of summer, Emperor Wen personally attended the meeting at Ba Wei, to perform suburban audience to the Wei Yang Five Emperors. Thereafter, the Son of Heaven personally performed suburban sacrifices four times, and at Yong in the fourth month of summer sacrificed to the Five Emperors, constantly at the emergence of the sun, moon, Orion, Mercury, Net, sacrificing to each at their position. å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€ŒåƒŠäººå¯è¦‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸Šå¾€å¸¸é½ï¼Œä»¥æ•…ä¸è¦‹ã€‚ ä»Šé™›ä¸‹å¯ç‚ºè§€ï¼Œå¦‚ç·±åŸï¼Œç½®è„¯æ£—ï¼Œç¥äººå®œå¯è‡´ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä¸”åƒŠäººå¥½æ¨“å±…ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šä»¤é•·å®‰å‰‡ä½œèœšå»‰æ¡‚è§€ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰å‰‡ä½œç›Šå»¶å£½è§€ï¼Œä½¿å¿æŒç¯€è¨­å…·è€Œå€™ç¥äººã€‚ ä¹ƒä½œé€šå¤©è–è‡ºï¼Œç½®ç¥ å…·å…¶ä¸‹ï¼Œå°‡æ‹›ä¾†åƒŠç¥äººä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ç”˜æ³‰æ›´ç½®å‰æ®¿ï¼Œå§‹å»£è«¸å®®å®¤ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œæœ‰èŠç”Ÿæ®¿æˆ¿å…§ä¸­ã€‚ å¤©å­ç‚ºå¡æ²³ï¼Œèˆˆé€šå¤©è‡ºï¼Œè‹¥è¦‹æœ‰å…‰äº‘ï¼Œä¹ƒä¸‹è©”ï¼šã€Œç”˜æ³‰æˆ¿ä¸­ç”ŸèŠä¹è–ï¼Œèµ¦å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œæ¯‹æœ‰å¾©ä½œã€‚ã€
Gong Sun Qing said: 'Immortals can be seen; the emperor went often hastily; because of this they were not seen. The Yellow Emperor mounted, his ministers and palace attendants who followed numbered over seventy, then the dragon ascended. Moreover immortals like tower dwellings.' The common people gazed up as the Yellow Emperor ascended to heaven, then embraced his bow and beard wailing. Therefore later generations named the place Ding Lake, his bow Wu Hao. The Yellow Emperor gathered copper from Shou Mountain, cast tripods at the foot of Jing Mountain. That summer, auspicious mushrooms sprouted inside the palace hall. The Son of Heaven for blocking the river raised the Tong Tian platform; as if he saw there was light, they say; he then issued an edict: 'Gan Quan room midst has born nine mushroom stems; amnesty all under heaven; no repeat work.'
91
å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œä¼æœé®®ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œæ—±ã€‚ å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚å°å‰‡å¤©æ—±ï¼Œä¹¾å°ä¸‰å¹´ã€‚ã€ ä¸Šä¹ƒä¸‹è©”æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©æ—±ï¼Œæ„ä¹¾å°ä¹ï¼Ÿ å…¶ä»¤å¤©ä¸‹å°Šç¥ éˆæ˜Ÿç„‰ã€‚ã€
The following year, he launched a campaign against Chosun. That summer brought drought. Gong Sun Qing said: 'In Yellow Emperor's time when feng was performed then heaven had drought; dry feng three years.' The emperor then issued an edict saying: 'Heaven has drought; is it thinking of dry feng? We should command all under heaven to honor and sacrifice to the spirit star there.'
92
å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œä¸ŠéƒŠé›ï¼Œé€šå›ä¸­é“ï¼Œå·¡ä¹‹ã€‚ æ˜¥ï¼Œè‡³é³´æ¾¤ï¼Œå¾è¥¿æ²³æ­¸ã€‚
The next year, the emperor performed the suburban sacrifice at Yong, opened the Huizhong road, and toured along it. In spring, he reached Mingze and returned following the Xibe River.
93
å…¶æ˜å¹´å†¬ï¼Œä¸Šå·¡å—éƒ¡ï¼Œè‡³æ±Ÿé™µè€Œæ±ã€‚ ç™»ç¦®çŠä¹‹å¤©æŸ±å±±ï¼Œè™Ÿæ›°å—å²³ã€‚ æµ®æ±Ÿï¼Œè‡ªå°‹é™½å‡ºæ¨…é™½ï¼Œéå½­è ¡ï¼Œç¦®å…¶åå±±å·ã€‚ åŒ—è‡³ç‘¯é‚ªï¼Œå¹¶æµ·ä¸Šã€‚ å››æœˆä¸­ï¼Œè‡³å¥‰é«˜ä¿®å°ç„‰ã€‚
The following winter, the emperor toured the Nanguan commandery, reaching Jiangling before heading east. He ascended and performed rites at Mount Tianzhu in the Shan region, proclaiming it the Southern Peak. He sailed down the Yangtze, leaving from Xunyang at Congyang, passing Pengli Lake, and performing rites at its famous mountains and rivers. He arrived north at Langye, following the coastline. In mid-fourth month, he reached Fenggao and repaired the feng altar.
94
åˆï¼Œå¤©å­å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œæ³°å±±æ±åŒ—é˜¯å¤æ™‚æœ‰æ˜å ‚è™•ï¼Œè™•éšªä¸æ•ã€‚ ä¸Šæ¬²æ²»æ˜å ‚å¥‰é«˜æ—ï¼Œæœªæ›‰å…¶åˆ¶åº¦ã€‚ æ¿Ÿå—äººå…¬çŠå¸¶ä¸Šé»ƒå¸æ™‚æ˜å ‚åœ–ã€‚ æ˜å ‚åœ–ä¸­æœ‰ä¸€æ®¿ï¼Œå››é¢ç„¡å£ï¼Œä»¥èŒ…è“‹ï¼Œé€šæ°´ï¼Œåœœå®®å£ç‚ºè¤‡é“ï¼Œä¸Šæœ‰æ¨“ï¼Œå¾è¥¿å—å…¥ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ˜†ä¾–ï¼Œå¤©å­å¾ä¹‹å…¥ï¼Œä»¥æ‹œç¥ ä¸Šå¸ç„‰ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šä»¤å¥‰é«˜ä½œæ˜å ‚æ±¶ä¸Šï¼Œå¦‚å¸¶åœ–ã€‚ åŠäº”å¹´ä¿®å°ï¼Œå‰‡ç¥ å¤ªä¸€ã€äº”å¸æ–¼æ˜å ‚ä¸Šåï¼Œä»¤é«˜çš‡å¸ç¥ åå°ä¹‹ã€‚ ç¥ ååœŸæ–¼ä¸‹æˆ¿ï¼Œä»¥äºŒåå¤ªç‰¢ã€‚ å¤©å­å¾æ˜†ä¾–é“å…¥ï¼Œå§‹æ‹œæ˜å ‚å¦‚éƒŠç¦®ã€‚ ç¦®ç•¢ï¼Œç‡å ‚ä¸‹ã€‚ è€Œä¸Šåˆä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œè‡ªæœ‰ç¥•ç¥ å…¶å·”ã€‚ è€Œæ³°å±±ä¸‹ç¥ äº”å¸ï¼Œå„å¦‚å…¶æ–¹ï¼Œé»ƒå¸å¹¶èµ¤å¸ï¼Œè€Œæœ‰å¸ä¾ç¥ ç„‰ã€‚ å±±ä¸Šèˆ‰ç«ï¼Œä¸‹æ‚‰æ‡‰ä¹‹ã€‚
Originally, when the Son of Heaven performed the feng sacrifice on Mount Tai, the northeast slope had an ancient site for the Bright Hall, but it was dangerous and cramped. The emperor wished to build a Bright Hall beside Fenggao, but had not yet determined its proper design. A man from Jinan named Gong Yudai presented a diagram of the Bright Hall from the Yellow Emperor's era. The diagram showed a single hall in the center, open on all four sides with a thatched roof, surrounded by water, with a circular wall forming covered walkways. A tower rose above it, entered from the southwest and named Kunlun. The Son of Heaven entered following this design to bow and sacrifice to the Supreme Deity. The emperor then ordered Fenggao to construct a Bright Hall above the Wen River, following the diagram. Five years later, when repairing the feng sacrifice, he sacrificed to Taiyi and the Five Emperors at the upper seat of the Bright Hall, with Gaozu's sacrificial seat facing them. He sacrificed to Houtu in the lower chamber with twenty sets of grand sacrificial victims. The Son of Heaven entered via the Kunlun passage, beginning to bow at the Bright Hall in the manner of suburban rites. The rites completed, the sacrificial fire was lit below the hall. The emperor then ascended Mount Tai again, conducting a private sacrifice at its summit. Below the mountain, sacrifices were made to the Five Emperors, each in their proper direction. The Yellow Emperor was combined with the Red Emperor, with officials attending the ceremonies. Fires were lit on the mountain top, with all below responding in kind.
95
å…¶å¾ŒäºŒæ­²ï¼Œåä¸€æœˆç”²å­æœ”æ—¦å†¬è‡³ï¼Œæ¨æ­·è€…ä»¥æœ¬çµ±ã€‚ å¤©å­è¦ªè‡³æ³°å±±ï¼Œä»¥åä¸€æœˆç”²å­æœ”æ—¦å†¬è‡³æ—¥ç¥ ä¸Šå¸æ˜å ‚ï¼Œæ¯‹ä¿®å°ç¦ªã€‚ å…¶è´Šé¥—æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©å¢æˆçš‡å¸å¤ªå…ƒç¥ç­–ï¼Œå‘¨è€Œå¾©å§‹ã€‚ çš‡å¸æ•¬æ‹œå¤ªä¸€ã€‚ã€ æ±è‡³æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè€ƒå…¥æµ·åŠæ–¹å£«æ±‚ç¥è€…ï¼Œè«é©—ï¼Œç„¶ç›Šé£ï¼Œå†€é‡ä¹‹ã€‚
Two years later, on the jiazi day of the eleventh month's new moon and winter solstice dawn, the calendar officials followed the original system. The Son of Heaven personally arrived at Mount Tai, sacrificing to the Supreme Deity at the Bright Hall on the eleventh month's jiazi new moon winter solstice dawn, without repairing the feng and shan. Its zan xiang said: 'Heaven increased and bestowed on the emperor the Tai Yuan spirit tally, cycled and began again. The emperor respectfully bowed to Tai Yi.' He traveled east to the seacoast, examining those who ventured into the sea and the fangshi seeking spirits. None proved genuine, yet he sent out more expeditions, hoping for success.
96
åä¸€æœˆä¹™é…‰ï¼ŒæŸæ¢ç½ã€‚ åäºŒæœˆç”²åˆæœ”ï¼Œä¸Šè¦ªç¦ªé«˜é‡Œï¼Œç¥ ååœŸã€‚ è‡¨å‹ƒæµ·ï¼Œå°‡ä»¥æœ›ç¥€è“¬èŠä¹‹å±¬ï¼Œå†€è‡³æ®Šå»·ç„‰ã€‚
In the eleventh month, on the yiyou day, the Cypress Beam Palace suffered a fire. On the jiawu new moon of the twelfth month, the emperor personally performed the shan sacrifice at Gaoli, offering to Houtu. Facing the Bohai Sea, he was about to gaze in sacrifice toward the Penglai islands, hoping to reach their transcendent courts.
97
ä¸Šé‚„ï¼Œä»¥æŸæ¢ç½æ•…ï¼Œæœå—è¨ˆç”˜æ³‰ã€‚ å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸å°±é’éˆè‡ºï¼ŒåäºŒæ—¥ç‡’ï¼Œé»ƒå¸ä¹ƒæ²»æ˜å»·ã€‚ æ˜å»·ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ æ–¹å£«å¤šè¨€å¤å¸ç‹æœ‰éƒ½ç”˜æ³‰è€…ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œå¤©å­åˆæœè«¸ä¾¯ç”˜æ³‰ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰ä½œè«¸ä¾¯é‚¸ã€‚ å‹‡ä¹‹ä¹ƒæ›°ï¼šã€Œè¶Šä¿—æœ‰ç«ç½ï¼Œå¾©èµ·å±‹å¿…ä»¥å¤§ï¼Œç”¨å‹æœä¹‹ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä½œå»ºç« å®®ï¼Œåº¦ç‚ºåƒé–€è¬æˆ¶ã€‚ å‰æ®¿åº¦é«˜æœªå¤®ã€‚ å…¶æ±å‰‡é³³é—•ï¼Œé«˜äºŒåé¤˜ä¸ˆã€‚ å…¶è¥¿å‰‡å”ä¸­ï¼Œæ•¸åé‡Œè™åœˆã€‚ å…¶åŒ—æ²»å¤§æ± ï¼Œæ¼¸è‡ºé«˜äºŒåé¤˜ä¸ˆï¼Œå‘½æ›°å¤ªæ¶²æ± ï¼Œä¸­æœ‰è“¬èŠã€æ–¹ä¸ˆã€ç€›æ´²ã€å£ºæ¢ï¼Œè±¡æµ·ä¸­ç¥å±±é¾œé­šä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ å…¶å—æœ‰ç‰å ‚ã€ç’§é–€ã€å¤§é³¥ä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ ä¹ƒç«‹ç¥æ˜è‡ºã€äº•å¹¹æ¨“ï¼Œåº¦äº”åä¸ˆï¼Œè¼¦é“ç›¸å±¬ç„‰ã€‚
On his return, due to the Cypress Beam fire, he held court at Ganquan Palace to receive the annual accounts. Gong Sun Qing said: 'The Yellow Emperor approached the Qing Ling Platform; twelve days it burned; the Yellow Emperor then repaired the bright court. The bright court was Gan Quan.' The fangshi often claimed that ancient emperors and kings had capitals at Ganquan. Afterward, the Son of Heaven again received the feudal lords at Ganquan, where mansions were built for them. Yong Zhi then said: 'Yue customs have fire disasters; again raising houses must be with large ones, use to overcome and subdue it.' Thus he built the Jianzhang Palace, designed with a thousand gates and ten thousand chambers. Its front hall was as tall as the Weiyang Palace. To the east stood the Phoenix Tower, over twenty zhang high. To the west was the Tangzhong enclosure, with tiger pens spanning several dozen li. To the north, a great pool was dug with a pavilion over twenty zhang high, named Taiye Pool. Within it were islands representing Penglai, Fangzhang, Yingzhou, and Hulushan, modeled after the divine mountains, turtles, and fish of the sea. To the south stood the Jade Hall, the Jade Gate, and structures shaped like great birds. He then built the Shenming Terrace and the Jinggan Tower, fifty zhang high, connected by palanquin roads.
98
å¤ï¼Œæ¼¢æ”¹æ­·ï¼Œä»¥æ­£æœˆç‚ºæ­²é¦–ï¼Œè€Œè‰²ä¸Šé»ƒï¼Œå®˜åæ›´å°ç« ä»¥äº”å­—ï¼Œç‚ºå¤ªåˆå…ƒå¹´ã€‚ æ˜¯æ­²ï¼Œè¥¿ä¼å¤§å®›ã€‚ è—å¤§èµ·ã€‚ ä¸å¤«äººã€é›’é™½è™åˆç­‰ä»¥æ–¹ç¥ è©›åŒˆå¥´ã€å¤§å®›ç„‰ã€‚
That summer, the Han reformed the calendar, making the first month the start of the year, with yellow as the ruling color. Official titles and seal characters were changed using five characters, marking the first year of the Taichu era. That year, they campaigned west against Dayuan. A massive locust plague erupted. Lady Ding, Yu Chu of Luoyang, and others used occult methods to sacrifice and curse the Xiongnu and Dayuan.
99
å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œæœ‰å¸ä¸Šè¨€é›äº”ç•¤ç„¡ç‰¢ç†Ÿå…·ï¼ŒèŠ¬èŠ³ä¸å‚™ã€‚ ä¹ƒä»¤ç¥ å®˜é€²ç•¤çŠ¢ç‰¢å…·ï¼Œè‰²é£Ÿæ‰€å‹ï¼Œè€Œä»¥æœ¨ç¦ºé¦¬ä»£é§’ç„‰ã€‚ ç¨äº”æœˆå˜—é§’ï¼Œè¡Œè¦ªéƒŠç”¨é§’ã€‚ åŠè«¸åå±±å·ç”¨é§’è€…ï¼Œæ‚‰ä»¥æœ¨ç¦ºé¦¬ä»£ã€‚ è¡Œéï¼Œä¹ƒç”¨é§’ã€‚ ä»–ç¦®å¦‚æ•…ã€‚
The following year, officials reported that Yong's five altars lacked proper sacrificial victims and fragrant offerings. He ordered the sacrificial officials to provide calves and full offerings for the altars, using colors and foods that matched each deity's preferences, and substituting wooden horses for live colts. Only in the fifth month did they taste the colts; for the emperor's personal suburban sacrifice, live colts were used. For all other famous mountains and rivers that required colts, wooden horses were substituted. Only after the ceremony was complete were live colts used. All other rites remained unchanged.
100
å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œæ±å·¡æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè€ƒç¥åƒŠä¹‹å±¬ï¼Œæœªæœ‰é©—è€…ã€‚ æ–¹å£«æœ‰è¨€ã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚ç‚ºäº”åŸåäºŒæ¨“ï¼Œä»¥å€™ç¥äººæ–¼åŸ·æœŸï¼Œå‘½æ›°è¿å¹´ã€ã€‚ ä¸Šè¨±ä½œä¹‹å¦‚æ–¹ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ˜å¹´ã€‚ ä¸Šè¦ªç¦®ç¥ ä¸Šå¸ç„‰ã€‚
The following year, touring east along the seacoast, he examined the spirit immortals, but found none who could be verified. The method masters said: 'In the Yellow Emperor's time they made five cities and twelve towers, to await spirit people at the Holding Period, named Welcoming Year.' The emperor approved building it according to the method, naming it the Welcoming Year. The emperor personally performed rites and sacrificed to the Supreme Deity there.
101
å…¬çŠå¸¶æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚é›–å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç„¶é¢¨åã€å°å·¨ã€å²ä¼¯ä»¤é»ƒå¸å°æ±æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªå‡¡å±±ï¼Œåˆç¬¦ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œä¸æ­»ç„‰ã€‚ã€ å¤©å­æ—¢ä»¤è¨­ç¥ å…·ï¼Œè‡³æ±æ³°å±±ï¼Œï¼»æ±ï¼½æ³°å±±å‘å°ï¼Œä¸ç¨±å…¶è²ï¼Œä¹ƒä»¤ç¥ å®˜ç¦®ä¹‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸å°ç¦ªç„‰ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä»¤å¸¶å¥‰ç¥ å€™ç¥ç‰©ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œé‚é‚„æ³°å±±ï¼Œä¿®äº”å¹´ä¹‹ç¦®å¦‚å‰ï¼Œè€ŒåŠ ä»¥ç¦ªç¥ çŸ³é–­ã€‚ çŸ³é–­è€…ï¼Œåœ¨æ³°å±±ä¸‹é˜¯å—æ–¹ï¼Œæ–¹å£«å¤šè¨€æ­¤åƒŠäººä¹‹é–­ä¹Ÿï¼Œæ•…ä¸Šè¦ªç¦ªç„‰ã€‚
Gong Yu Dai said: 'Although in the Yellow Emperor's time they performed feng at Tai Mountain, Feng Hou, Feng Ju, and Qi Bo commanded the Yellow Emperor to perform feng at East Tai Mountain, shan at Fan Mountain, unite the tally, and only then would he not die.' The Son of Heaven had already commanded the setting up of sacrifice equipment, arrived at East Tai Mountain; East Tai Mountain was low and small, not matching its reputation, so he commanded the sacrifice officials to perform rites to it, but did not perform feng shan there. Afterwards he commanded Dai to serve the sacrifice and await spirit things. In summer, he then returned to Tai Mountain, performed the five-year rites like before, and added a shan sacrifice at Stone Gate. Stone Gate was at Tai Mountain's lower zi in the south; the method masters often said this was the gate of the immortal people, therefore the emperor personally performed shan there.
102
å…¶å¾Œäº”å¹´ï¼Œå¾©è‡³æ³°å±±ä¿®å°ã€‚ é‚„éç¥­æ’å±±ã€‚
Five years later, he again arrived at Tai Mountain and repaired the feng. On his return he passed by and sacrificed at Heng Mountain.
103
ä»Šå¤©å­æ‰€èˆˆç¥ ï¼Œå¤ªä¸€ã€ååœŸï¼Œä¸‰å¹´è¦ªéƒŠç¥ ï¼Œå»ºæ¼¢å®¶å°ç¦ªï¼Œäº”å¹´ä¸€ä¿®å°ã€‚ è–„å¿Œå¤ªä¸€åŠä¸‰ä¸€ã€å†¥ç¾Šã€é¦¬è¡Œã€èµ¤æ˜Ÿï¼Œäº”ï¼Œå¯¬èˆ’ä¹‹ç¥ å®˜ä»¥æ­²æ™‚è‡´ç¦®ã€‚ å‡¡å…­ç¥ ï¼Œçš†å¤ªç¥é ˜ä¹‹ã€‚ è‡³å¦‚å…«ç¥è«¸ç¥ï¼Œæ˜å¹´ã€å‡¡å±±ä»–åç¥ ï¼Œè¡Œéå‰‡ç¥ ï¼Œè¡Œå»å‰‡å·²ã€‚ æ–¹å£«æ‰€èˆˆç¥ ï¼Œå„è‡ªä¸»ï¼Œå…¶äººçµ‚å‰‡å·²ï¼Œç¥ å®˜ä¸ä¸»ã€‚ ä»–ç¥ çš†å¦‚å…¶æ•…ã€‚ ä»Šä¸Šå°ç¦ªï¼Œå…¶å¾ŒåäºŒæ­²è€Œé‚„ï¼Œéæ–¼äº”å²³ã€å››ç€†çŸ£ã€‚ è€Œæ–¹å£«ä¹‹å€™ç¥ ç¥äººï¼Œå…¥æµ·æ±‚è“¬èŠï¼Œçµ‚ç„¡æœ‰é©—ã€‚ è€Œå…¬å­«å¿ä¹‹å€™ç¥è€…ï¼ŒçŒ¶ä»¥å¤§äººä¹‹è·¡ç‚ºè§£ï¼Œç„¡æœ‰æ•ˆã€‚ å¤©å­ç›Šæ€ å­æ–¹å£«ä¹‹æ€ªè¿‚èªçŸ£ï¼Œç„¶ç¾ˆç¸»ä¸çµ•ï¼Œå†€é‡å…¶çœŸã€‚ è‡ªæ­¤ä¹‹å¾Œï¼Œæ–¹å£«è¨€ç¥ç¥ è€…å½Œçœ¾ï¼Œç„¶å…¶æ•ˆå¯ç¹çŸ£ã€‚ å¤ªå²å…¬æ›°ï¼šä½™å¾å·¡ç¥­å¤©åœ°è«¸ç¥åå±±å·è€Œå°ç¦ªç„‰ã€‚ å…¥å£½å®®ä¾ç¥ ç¥èªï¼Œç©¶è§€æ–¹å£«ç¥ å®˜ä¹‹æ„ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯é€€è€Œè«–æ¬¡è‡ªå¤ä»¥ä¾†ç”¨äº‹æ–¼é¬¼ç¥è€…ï¼Œå…·è¦‹å…¶è¡¨è£ã€‚ å¾Œæœ‰å›å­ï¼Œå¾—ä»¥è¦½ç„‰ã€‚ è‹¥è‡³ä¿è±†çªå¹£ä¹‹è©³ï¼Œç»é…¬ä¹‹ç¦®ï¼Œå‰‡æœ‰å¸å­˜ã€‚
Now the sacrifices established by the Son of Heaven were Tai Yi and Hou Tu; every three years he personally performed suburban sacrifices, established the Han house feng shan, and every five years once repaired the feng. Bo Ji Tai Yi and the Three Ones, Dark Sheep, Horse Travel, Red Starâ€”five in totalâ€”Kuan Shu's sacrifice officials presented rites according to the seasons of the year. Altogether six sacrifices, all were led by the Grand Blessing. As for the eight spirits and various spirits, Welcoming Year, Fan Mountain and other named sacrifices, when he traveled past them he sacrificed, when he traveled on he stopped. The sacrifices established by method masters, each was self-managed; when the person ended, then it stopped; the sacrifice officials did not manage them. Other sacrifices were all as before. Now the emperor performed feng shan; twelve years later he returned, having been universal to the five peaks and four waterways. And the method masters who awaited and sacrificed to spirit people, entered the sea seeking Peng Lai, but in the end none had verification. And Gong Sun Qing's spirit-awaiters still used the tracks of great persons as explanations, but none had any effect. The Son of Heaven increasingly grew weary and disgusted with the method masters' strange and circuitous words, however he kept them restrained but not cut off, hoping to encounter their true ones. From this time afterwards, the method masters who spoke of spirit sacrifices became increasingly many, however their effects could be clearly seen. The Grand Historian said: I followed along as we toured and sacrificed to the heaven, earth, various spirits, famous mountains and rivers, and performed feng shan there. I entered the Longevity Palace and served the sacrifice spirit words; I thoroughly observed the intentions of the method masters and sacrifice officials; thereupon I withdrew and arranged in order those who had used matters with ghosts and spirits from ancient times onward, fully seeing their exterior and interior. Afterwards, superior men could obtain to view it there. If it comes to the details of zu, dou, gui, and bi, the rites of xian and chou, then the officials preserve them.
